intro: Pentaceros, commonly known as the five-angled or star-shaped plant, is a genus of flowering plants belonging to the family Apiaceae. It is characterized by its distinctive, often aromatic leaves that are deeply lobed or divided into five parts, giving it its common name. The flowers are typically small and clustered in umbels, a feature common in many members of the carrot family. The plant is native to various regions in Europe and Asia, where it thrives in moist, temperate climates. Due to its unique morphology and potential medicinal properties, Pentaceros has been of interest to botanists and herbalists alike.
